title: Pierre-Auguste Renoir Two Sisters (On the Terrace) Matted Note Card
description:
Print developed from Pierre-Auguste Renoir’s Two Sisters (On the Terrace), 1881, from the Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

Two Sisters (On the Terrace) is one of the most popular paintings in the Art Institute. Here Renoir depicted the radiance of lovely young women on a warm and beautiful day. The older girl, wearing the female boater’s blue ?annel, is posed in the center. She gazes absently beyond her younger companion, who seems, in a charming visual conceit, to have just dashed into the picture. Renoir juxtaposed solid, almost life-size figures against a landscape that—like a stage set—seems a realm of pure vision and fantasy.
  • Print Reproduction
  • Image Dimensions: 4.25 x 5.5 in.
  • Full Dimensions: 8 x 10 in.
  • Materials: Premium cardstock.
